info.description:
Authentick API with comprehensive error handling and standardized responses.

## Error Response Structure
All error responses follow this standardized structure:
```json
{
"success": false,
"error": {
"code": "ERROR_CODE",
"message": "Human-readable error message",
"details": "Additional context about the error (optional)",
"field": "field_name (for validation errors)"
},
"meta": {
"request_id": "unique-request-id",
"timestamp": "2025-10-19T12:00:00Z"
}
}
```

## Error Codes Reference

### Authentication Errors (HTTP 401)
- `UNAUTHORIZED`: Authentication required - No valid authentication credentials provided
- `INVALID_TOKEN`: Invalid or malformed token - The provided token is invalid or corrupted
- `TOKEN_EXPIRED`: Token has expired - The authentication token has expired and needs renewal
- `INVALID_CREDENTIALS`: Invalid credentials - The provided credentials are incorrect

### Authorization Errors (HTTP 403)
- `FORBIDDEN`: Access denied - User lacks permission to access this resource
- `INSUFFICIENT_PERMISSIONS`: Insufficient permissions - User role doesn't have required permissions

### Validation Errors (HTTP 400)
- `VALIDATION_ERROR`: Validation failed - One or more fields failed validation
- `INVALID_INPUT`: Invalid input provided - The input data format is incorrect
- `MISSING_FIELD`: Required field is missing - A required field was not provided
- `INVALID_FORMAT`: Invalid format - Data format doesn't match expected pattern

### Resource Errors
- `NOT_FOUND` (404): Resource not found - The requested resource doesn't exist
- `ALREADY_EXISTS` (409): Resource already exists - Attempting to create a duplicate resource
- `CONFLICT` (409): Resource conflict - The request conflicts with current resource state
- `RESOURCE_EXHAUSTED` (429): Resource exhausted - Resource quota or limit reached

### External Service Errors
- `EXTERNAL_SERVICE_ERROR` (502): External service error - Dependent external service failed
- `SERVICE_UNAVAILABLE` (503): Service unavailable - Service is temporarily unavailable
- `TIMEOUT` (408): Request timeout - The request took too long to process

### Internal Server Errors (HTTP 500)
- `INTERNAL_ERROR`: Internal server error - An unexpected error occurred
- `DATABASE_ERROR`: Database error - Database operation failed
- `CACHE_ERROR`: Cache error - Cache operation failed
- `FILESYSTEM_ERROR`: File system error - File operation failed

### Rate Limiting Errors (HTTP 429)
- `RATE_LIMITED`: Rate limit exceeded - Too many requests from this client
- `TOO_MANY_REQUESTS`: Too many requests - Request threshold exceeded

### Request Errors
- `REQUEST_TOO_LARGE` (413): Request too large - Request payload exceeds size limit
- `INVALID_CONTENT_TYPE` (415): Invalid content type - Unsupported media type provided

## Success Response Structure
All successful responses follow this structure:
```json
{
"success": true,
"data": { ... },
"meta": {
"request_id": "unique-request-id",
"timestamp": "2025-10-19T12:00:00Z",
"pagination": {
"page": 1,
"limit": 20,
"total": 100,
"total_pages": 5
}
}
}
```
info.title: Authentick APIs

get.description: Returns application information, server status, and system statistics
Get all generic invite codes with pagination

post.description: Create a new generic invite code for campaigns
Deactivate a generic invite code
Authenticates a user with access token from Authorization header or Google OAuth token. If user doesn't exist, creates a new user account

parameters.description: Bearer token (optional if google_token is provided)
parameters.name: Authorization

post.description: Authenticates a user with an access token
Invalidates the user's current token

get.description: Returns the current authenticated user's information

post.description: Generates a new access token and refresh token pair using a valid refresh token
Validates a token and returns user information

get.description: Get all connections for the authenticated user with optional filters

parameters.description: Predefined relationship filter (close_friends, friends, following, followers) - only one value allowed
parameters.name: type

post.description: Send a connection request to another user
Block a user to prevent any interaction

get.description: Check if a connection exists with another user and get its details

parameters.description: User ID to check connection with
parameters.name: userId

get.description: Get all pending connection requests received by the authenticated user
Get all connection requests sent by the authenticated user
Get statistics about the authenticated user's connections
Get details of a specific connection by ID

delete.description: Remove an existing connection between users

patch.description: Update a connection by accepting/rejecting/canceling it or changing its type

post.description: Check if an invite code is valid and can be used
Create a new post with optional media

get.description: Get posts from connections based on visibility and filter type. Filter options: friends (posts from friends and close friends), following (posts from users you're following), everyone (posts from all accepted connections)

post.description: Generates presigned URLs for uploading post media files. Enforces S3 key pattern: users/{user_id}/media/{timestamp}_{index}.{ext}
post.summary: Get presigned URLs for post media upload

get.description: Get all posts by a specific user
Get a specific post by ID

delete.description: Delete a post and all its associated data

get.description: Get all comments for a post

post.description: Add a comment to a post
Like a post

get.description: Get all users who liked a post

delete.description: Permanently deletes the authenticated user's account and all associated data for GDPR/EULA compliance. This action cannot be undone.

post.description: Looks up users by email addresses and returns their basic info with connection status for the "find your friends" feature
Confirms that an image was successfully uploaded using presigned URL

delete.description: Deletes a profile or cover image for the authenticated user

get.description: Retrieves onboarding progress for the current authenticated user

post.description: Updates a specific onboarding step for the authenticated user (default action=skip; only share_first_moment supports action=complete)

parameters.description: Step action payload (default action=skip; only share_first_moment supports action=complete)
parameters.name: request

post.description: Generates a presigned URL for direct image upload to S3. Returns both the presigned URL and the expected image URL for confirmation.
post.summary: Get presigned upload URL for image

get.description: Retrieves the authenticated user's profile information

put.description: Updates the authenticated user's profile information

post.description: Uploads a profile or cover image for the authenticated user
Adds a user to the waitlist when they don't yet have an invite code.

username.description: Optional fields for user creation if user doesn't exist

is_liked.description: Whether current user liked this post

is_connected.description: Whether current user is connected to this user

BearerAuth.description: Bearer token authentication. Enter your token in the format: "Bearer <your-token>"
BearerAuth.name: Authorization
